items.content:
*Business Development & Research Assistant*

We have an IOS MVP that’s 90% complete and a Pitch Deck ready to send your way outlining everything about Reeltime.

*What we’re looking for:*

We’re looking for a Business Development & Research Assistant that can help us analyse the market and speak to our target audience in order for us to continue building the perfect product.

*Who we want you to connect with:*

Vloggers, Influencer’s, Travel bloggers, Video Producers or anyone thats’s active in creating video or using Instagram stories.This is a great opportunity to get involved in an early stage startup and help steer us in the perfect direction for the future.

We assure you this is something you want to be a part of. See our summary below:

*Why?*

Video is King.

There are more content creators than ever before. We want to give them the right tools to make high quality, captivating and fun content, fast. As our smart phone’s video capture and processing capabilities continuously improve, our apps and the experiences they offer must improve with them.

So we’re building and launching our MVP.

*What is it?*

REELTIME is an incredibly simple live video editing app that’s had an overwhelmingly positive response to our initial Demo and Pitch Deck. Everyone loves it.

@RachelleHay _“I would find an app like that super helpful!"_

Siobhan Mcauley _“And alexouthwaite that app sounds amazing especially for us”_

@joshahdashian _“I love the concept and as soon as it’s out I’m downloading it!”_

@thebiggsisland _“I agree that would be awesome”_

@LiamWalker _“That would be handy for me as someone who rarely does videos and would like to make it a little more attractive!”_

@Vivien Bass _“Oh yes!! Ive been dreaming of it!!”_

***************************************************

The UXUI has been fully designed and it’s well and truly validated with some incredible features and roadmap to follow.

The IOS MVP version is 90% complete and we’re also looking into android development too.

*APPLICANT REQUIREMENTS:*

- Highly familiar with Instagram and social media.

- Confident & professional communication skills.

- Intuitive and self motivated.

- Design skills a bonus.

- Be seriously passionate about building things!

***************************************************

We also have a very strong network of people who will be able to test and market this GLOBALLY across social media. Our Advisory board is also fantastic and Investment talks are taking place.

You’d be coming on board as an someone that’s able to work remotely and in your own time so it’s therefore unpaid but should give great experience and be good fun.Depending on experience/commitment we can discuss an equity deal.

Please say Hi and tell us a little bit about yourself along with your experience.

Let us know if you have any questions. We’d love to hear from you!

Demo and Pitch Deck available on request.

Based in Shoreditch, East London.

Leo

You're smart, hungry, and humble and excited about a high uncapped commission ($125K OTE), and generous equity.

items.title: Proposal Manager
items.content:
Proposal Manager at Verint

Remote

Location: US-Remote (United States)

Job ID13024

Overview of Job Function:

This position is responsible for developing and producing proposals in support of Verint’s business activities. Ensures on-time submittal of high-quality proposals fully responsive to prospect’s requirements and internal Verint objectives. The Proposal Manager will work with regional, virtual-team project members, collecting inputs and preparation of the final proposal. The finished product is expected to be highly professional and representative of Verint’s world-class products and services.

Additional responsibilities include developing and producing other proposal tools, documents and reports, and maintaining a proposal library.

Principal Duties and Essential Responsibilities:

  • Project manage virtual teams through proposal generation using documented RFP Process as guideline.
  • Plan, organize and coordinate the proposal development schedule.Lead proposal kick-off meetings.Schedule and lead response assignments, proposal reviews, production and delivery.
  • Source responses to questions from existing response databases and seek review and confirmation as needed.
  • Assign specific proposal items/sections to SMEs and Field Resources only when required.
  • Project Manage multiple proposal projects at a time, enforcing internal deadlines to meet customer expectations.
  • Collaborate with Legal, Marketing, Product Marketing and Product Management to source information and create response materials as needed
  • Collect feedback on all proposal wins/losses.
  • Manage the proposal database ensuring that boilerplate is accurate and contains the latest technical, product and corporate information.
  • Manage product, legal and security questionnaires.

Minimum Requirements:

  • Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience in technical/business writing or related field
  • At least 6 years general business experience with at least 3 years in proposal management role within a software environment
  • Prior experience in managing multiple projects successfully
  • Self-starter, highly organized, and able to work well with senior management levels in the organization. Ability to direct and monitor the activities of others in performance of work requiring accuracy and detail.
  • Must have the ability to handle multiple tasks and manage activities with a range of priorities; ability to manage multiple projects successfully
  • Must be self-motivated and highly energetic
  • Must have strong written, verbal, and interpersonal communication skills and word processing, word templates, desktop publishing and web application skills.
  • Must possess proofreading and editing skills and have the ability to work under tight deadlines.

Preferred Requirements:

  • Strong Microsoft Word and Adobe PDF knowledge
  • Adobe Creative Suite experience is a plus.
  • Strong leadership and consensus building skills
  • RFP proposal generation in the Workforce Optimization or Call Center industry
  • Experience with Managing Public Sector Proposals
  • Proven track record in producing winning proposals for software contracts
  • Experience with proposal processes and knowledge of Shipley proposal methodology
  • Experience working on small and large complex proposals for a software company.
  • Additional language fluency (Spanish, Portuguese, French)
Apply for job

items.content:
Sales Appointment Setting at Time Doctor

Remote | International

Location: Worldwide

We need telephone appointment setters to work USA hours. You will be paid a very good base salary plus generous commissions.

Were looking for someone to telecommute and engage with our free trial users, answer their questions, qualify them and configure their trial and invite their employees to track time with Time Doctor.

Why did Yahoo famously ban remote working? Their team were ‘slacking off like crazy, not being available, spending a lot of time on non-Yahoo! Projects.’ Thats exactly where our software comes in.

Time Doctor helps remote teams to be more productive, have less stress, lower job turnover and saves the company money on real estate costs/overhead. It also builds trust and reliance in the company.

We are generating between 10,000 and 20,000 free trials per month, and were just getting started. Thats where you come in.

You will start working remotely and then will need to come to Canada for a one-month training with our Sales Director and then you will go back to your home country to continue your remote work.

This role consists of:

  1. Identifying leads. We do have a research team but you might need to be involved.
  2. Managing a pipeline. This will be the key to your success. You’ll need excellent time management skills. You will most likely have more leads than you can handle and youll need to be organized and purposeful.
  3. Account management. Compared to some sales teams where a deal is closed and passed on to another team immediately, you will want to keep in touch with your accounts after the hand off to customer success to ensure they add as many employees to their account in the first 2 months to maximize your commission and convince them to give you referrals!

To be the best match for this job, you need to have these key skills:

  1. Language. English
  2. Hustle. You need to be able to track down busy people and get them to talk to you. This requires creative communication, research, and hustle.
  3. Quick task switching. The team is in growth mode, youll be expected to quickly switch between researching new trial users & phoning them, replying to chat (in under 1 minute), customizing emails, configuring trial accounts and reviewing reports with business owners
  4. Persistence. We mentioned this above, but it bears reiteration. You might need to email or phone someone 6 times before you catch their attention. We need someone willing to push hard.
  5. Communication. Time Doctor is 100% remote – everybody needs to be able to write, speak and communicate well.
  6. Curiosity. To excel in this role, you need to be able to build a deep understanding of each of the verticals we sell to. That means knowing the events, companies, products, and most importantly, people, in each of these verticals and having your finger to the pulse of any changes or developments.
  7. Experience in software sales, remote work and management is a plus.

Please upload your resume and answer all the questions required in the application page.

Only those who complete them will be considered for this job.

ABOUT OUR COMPANY AND PRODUCT

Our vision is to be the most trusted time tracking and productivity application for remote teams. We want to help companies know if their remote teams are working productively.

We develop and market Time Doctor, a time-tracking and productivity tool. Our software can be used by individuals or teams to track time for tasks and to monitor computer activity by taking screenshots while working, monitoring keyboard and mouse activity, and tracking web app and website usage.

We have a team of over 65 people working 100% remotely in 28 different countries.

Apply for job

items.content:
Business Development Representative

Company: 10x Travel
Headquarters: London
https://10x.travel/start/bdr-wanted/
Want to Be Part of Something Different? We're Hiring!

Business Development Rep for Marketing Technology Company in the Travel Industry

Do you want to take the next step in your career as a sales pro?
...to set your own hours and work from wherever you want?
...and get paid from the internet?

If the answer to all three is 'yes', then this might be the position for you!

We are offering you the opportunity we wished we’d had years ago. You’ll be working hard, learning new skill sets, being mentored by people who care about your professional development, all while living/working in any location you choose.

So you might be wondering...

What’s The Opportunity?

We’re hiring a Business Development Representative (BDR) to help us expand our sales qualification process for new customers.

Initially, you’ll be learning more about the business, our process, and the types of customers we typically work with.

Ultimately, you’ll be helping potential customers better understand our buying/selling process and persuading them to schedule appointments with our CEO.

You’ll be developing relationships, answering questions and speaking to prospects by email, via chat, and over the phone.

This is a full-time position (approximately 35 hours per week) working with us as at 10x Travel. The initial contract is for 6 months, with a $1,800 monthly base salary plus incentive structure for high performance.

But we’re really looking for someone who can take charge and run profitable sections of our business long-term. Someone who will stay on through 2019 and beyond.

Ideally, you’ll transition in to a senior management position long before the first 6 months are up as you take on additional responsibilities.

This is a location independent position, allowing you to work from wherever you’d like.

You will:

  • Get paid to learn everything about a range of digital sales and marketing disciplines.
  • Enjoy the benefits of remote work, getting things done and learning from wherever you want (as long as you can find a reliable internet connection).
  • Work with a best-in-class team and gain valuable skills with a successful, fast-growing and interesting company.
  • If you want to establish yourself as a world-class sales professional, this is your opportunity to make it happen.

Here is what some of our team members have said about working for us:

Chris Michael – VP of Revenue

“In the time I’ve been with 10x Travel, I’ve had the pleasure of working out of multiple locations across four different continents. Given my last job was in an office of 200 people, I can’t quite express how much that freedom means to me - working whilst I travel to such beautiful, scenic destinations, that before only made up two weeks of my year after I’d saved up some vacation days!

My passion for travel means the work is always interesting, and my colleagues here are awesome, which makes the day-to-day stuff really enjoyable. They’ve created a real environment for personal development, so when I’ve wanted to take a course to develop certain skills, the team have been more than happy to provide the opportunity for me to do so.”

Esmee Fitzgerald – Chief Operating Officer

“Working for 10x Travel started as a 10 hour per week role for me. Since then, the amount I’ve learned whilst being part of a growing business has been an unparalleled experience. I can’t quite put into words how much I care for our team and the future of 10x Travel.

“Living anywhere you want? Check. Work with not only co-workers, but close friends? Check. Find yourself willingly working in your spare time because of how fun it is? Check.”

What Will I Be Doing?

We’re not a Fortune 500 company, which means you won’t be just another employee in a cubicle.

As a BDR, you’ll be responsible for managing our sales inboxes, developing the interest of incoming leads, and closing appointment bookings to support our sales process.

You’ll be expected to take control of the existing operation, work with our revenue team to strategize current campaigns and build on current strategies and processes that currently have a ton of unrealized potential.

If you’re up for the task, you’ll gain yourself new skills, an impressive track record, and a remote job with a great team.

Here are examples of tasks you might be working on, day to day:

  • Communicating with the lead generation team, who run campaigns to generate new engaged prospects for the sales process
  • Emailing back a prospect who has engaged with one of our outreach campaigns
  • Updating and managing our Deals CRM, to maintain an accurate picture of our sales pipeline
  • Making a call to a potential customer wanting to know more about how we help tour operators grow sales
  • Scheduling a strategy session or sales demo between a potential customer and our CEO
  • Contributing to our SOPs (Standard Operating Procedures) with the things you do and learn on the job
  • Collaborating with our team, as part of our team, via Slack

Because we’re a smaller team, you should expect to wear different hats at times as the company continues to grow.

This Position Is Perfect For You If...

You love to empathise, influence and negotiate.

We want people that understand the dynamics of influence and persuasion, someone that is knowledgeable (or willing to become knowledgeable) about how to effectively sell and how to work with people. At this level, it’s not enough to be a bulldozer - you must have the innate ability to understand what someone else is going through, and to meet them where they’re at.

You’re creative and can bring in new prospects and opportunities.

We have a ton of processes in place, and our marketing machine is growing all the time, giving us more and more leads coming through our funnels. That being said, you should also bring your own unique set of skills to generate potential customers. Who knows? Maybe your unique set of skills is something we start making part of our standard procedures!

You have no problem reaching out to people (especially over the phone).

Our business has a lot of moving parts, and one of those moving parts is effective communication. You will be making calls, familiarizing prospects with our business, and persuading them to commit their time and energy to our consultation process. Ultimately, this is a sales position, so you need to be comfortable dealing with rejection, getting on the phone with strangers, and answering hostile questions as they come at you.

You're a self-starter.

We're looking for someone who gets shit done and delivers on time. Ideally you are self-directed, self-motivated, and don’t need someone to look over your shoulder or hold your hand. This is a remote position, so you’ll need to be organized enough to make sure that you’re on top of everything.

You’re a master of written communication.

Sales letters… proposal documents… prospecting emails... effective writing that cuts through the noise is a must-have skill in this sales game. Your wordsmithery needs to be tight, engaging and persuasive - and we’ll ask you to prove it. There should be no doubts about your style and ability to create a solid call to action.

You’re cool on digital marketing.

You don’t have to already be a marketing wizard, but if the terms ‘lead magnet’ and ‘email automation’ sound foreign to you, it might be worth reconsidering if you have the foundations this position requires. You’re going to be selling marketing technology, so you’re tech-savvy. Ideally you've read a few books, taken a few courses, or have a fledgling side project of your own that demonstrates your skills. Make sure you answer question three of the application with ‘plenty’ as the first word.

Anything Else?

We want hungry, eye-on-the-prize hustlers that are serious about changing their lives and building businesses.

This won’t be a walk in the park, but if you’re up for a challenge, this is a unique opportunity to level up your skills with a great team.

We don’t want to oversell this… it is an amazing opportunity, but we’re really looking for a good fit over anything else. Don’t think you’re qualified? You might be surprised. Go ahead and apply - we’ll be reviewing EVERY application.


How Do I Apply?

Here is the sequence of events we'll use to hire for this role:

Step 1: Record a Youtube video, fill out the application form, and submit ASAP.

Step 2: We review the submissions, shortlist the top 10 candidates and send out an aptitude test for you to complete. Time required: approximately one hour.

Step 3: We schedule video chat interviews with the top 3 candidates to make a final decision.

Step 4: We make our hiring announcement (October 15th).

Step 5: The chosen candidate starts working at 10x Travel (October 22nd).

The absolute LATEST date for you to submit your application form is September 30th.

YouTube Video Requirements:

We will only accept submissions that include a YouTube URL. Please leave the video “unlisted” in preferences and share the link with us. The quality of the video doesn’t matter, and there are no bonus points for expert editing. We just want no more than 5-7 minutes of you explaining, based on your previous experience:

  • Why is this an excellent fit for you and us?
  • How will you help us to improve our sales and attract more customers?
  • What separates you from the rest of the pack of applicants i.e. what makes you amazing?
  • What qualities do you think it takes to be a top-tier business development representative?

Apply for this position

To apply for the role, complete this application form - https://10x.travel/start/bdr-wanted/

items.title: Junior Small Business Finance Writer
items.content:
Junior Small Business Finance Writer at FitSmallBusiness.com

Remote

REMOTE OK

United States

Full-time

Salary: $45,000.00 to $50,000.00 /year

Marc Waring Ventures, the company behind the small business resource website FitSmallBusiness.com, is seeking a Finance Writer to join our editorial team.

Founded in 2013, FitSmallBusiness.com is read by over 1.5 million small business owners and managers each month. We are a fast growing NYC-based startup, with headquarters across the street from Grand Central. This position is open to remote work.

The Position

The small business finance writer will be an integral part of building the most comprehensive small business finance portal on the internet. We cover a wide range of topics related to small business finance, from improving credit scores to SBA loans to how to buy real estate for your business.

The best candidates will be a strong writer & researcher. While you may not have an extensive background in small business finance, you consider yourself a finance or econ nerd. You must have a strong affinity with small business owners. You will share our mission of breaking down complex financial subjects for small business owners so they can make smart decisions and grow their businesses.

This position includes:

  • Writing comparison articles of financial product providers.
  • Researching (including interviewing experts) and writing articles about specialty credit areas, such as trade finance, lending and commercial real estate.
  • Providing detailed responses to reader questions.
  • Developing infographics and visuals to support written content.
  • Build online tools like calculators and document templates.

Qualifications for success:

  • At least 2 years of relevant experience.
  • You are a great researcher and writer.
  • You are high energy, and passionate about helping small businesses.
  • You are comfortable working in a startup environment, where things change quickly.
  • You have a strong work ethic.

What we offer you:

  • Fully covered, high quality, $0 deductible health insurance
  • 401K plan with matching
  • A true meritocracy where you can grow as fast as your skills allow.
  • An open-minded, collaborative workplace, which will both challenge you and celebrate your work
  • The opportunity to work with bright, interesting, enthusiastic colleagues
Apply for job

items.content:
We’re seeking someone to help us with Business Development and Sales.


ZDEV is a young software consultancy which builds software for startups and SMEs. We have grown organically over the last two years and are now looking to hire a dedicated sales professional to help us build a pipeline of prospective clients and build our marketing strategy to help us scale up.

The role:


Finding new prospects / potential partners to contact
Contacting 10+ prospects each day (phone / email)
Keeping records of prospects and contacts in our CRM
Once leads are qualified handing them over to the CEO to convert
Working directly with the CEO on sales and other strategy
Leading on strategy, marketing, social media management,

About you:


5+ years experience in business development / sales
Previous experience with CRMs
Entrepreneurial mindset is important
Self starter - comfortable with autonomy - we want you to own as much as you can!
Help us define and improve our sales process - we’re very open to ideas.
Strong communicator, both written and verbal.
Generalist / jack of all trades
Quick learner

Location:

ZDEV is a remote company (we work from home). This role can be done remotely - but we’d prefer someone who can travel to London to meet with us a couple of times a month.

You must have the right to work in the UK.

Working hours:

For the right person we can be flexible about working hours.

Pay:

Salary £30k-45k + discretionary bonus based on performance. Significant progression likely for the right person.

Perks:



We meet as a company once a month to spend the day together and grab dinner on the company. We’re a friendly bunch!
Work from home - we can be flexible around your lifestyle if that’s important to you.
If you’d like to work from an office we can arrange that (near where you live - that’s possible too).
We’ll get you all the equipment you need - up to £2k
Training budget - spend 5+ days a year doing any training you want.



Please send your CV and why you think you’d be a good fit for this role.

Direct applicants only - no agencies / recruiters please.

items.content:
Junior Sales Development Representative
Ideally based in London

Our mission is to empower people and companies to use data to do transformative things. We provide technology and services that enables our users to collect the data that they want, use that data to understand each of one of their customer’s complete user journeys, and transform their business.

Snowplow has grown significantly over the last 12 months and we are now looking for our second Sales Development Representative to help us achieve even bigger things!

The Opportunity:
Our sales function is newly formed so, as the second Sales Development Representative there is enormous scope for a talented individual to progress quickly and have real impact on how this team is formed over the next few years. Starting with qualifying inbound leads, the role will see someone go on to work closely with our marketing function to create innovative outbound sales material.

Within 3-9 months (depending on individual progression, there’s no pressure to be a sales expert within a few weeks), you’ll also learn how to carry out demos of our product and how to guide a customer through the entire sales journey, from initial call to customer.

The environment you’ll be working in:
Our culture is as unique as our customers. Over half of our employees work remotely from all over the world so we have fostered an environment based on trust, communication and transparency. You won’t find micro-management here and everyone takes ownership of their work. Collaboration is at the core of everything we do – we work together and learn from each other.

What you’ll be doing:
Managing inbound sales queries in Salesforce
Qualifying inbound leads and carrying out initial calls with potential customers to assess how/if our product could add real value to their business
Working closely with our marketing team to start producing some outbound lead generation
Gaining deep knowledge of our product offering with a view to being able to take over some demo calls
Achieving (and hopefully exceeding) monthly and quarterly sales targets
Effectively managing your workload & prioritising tasks

What you bring to the team:
Min 1 year experience in a sales role (preferably within a data analytics/SaaS environment)
A conscientious, caring & team-oriented attitude
Drive, enthusiasm and creativity
Passion for technology and adding value to businesses through data
Fantastic communication skills, both written and verbal
Confident, calm and collected nature
Self-motivated and always looking for opportunities to learn & improve

What you’ll get in return:
A competitive package based on experience, including share options
25 days of holiday a year (plus bank holidays)
Freedom to work wherever suits you best
Two fantastic company Away-Weeks in a different European city each year (next one is Milan in May 2018!)
Work alongside a supportive and talented team
Grow and develop in a fast-moving, collaborative organisation
Enjoy fun events in and around London organised by our Cultural Work Committee
Learn to code or improve your existing skills with our Software Development Guild
Convenient location in central London (Shoreditch)
Continuous supply of Pact coffee
Regular events with the team

items.content:
Senior Social Media Manager

Marketing
Anywhere
Company: InVision
Full Time

Overview

InVision is the Digital Product Design platform used to make the world’s best customer experiences. We provide design tools and educational resources for teams to navigate every stage of the product design process, from ideation to development.

Today, more than 4 million people use InVision to create a repeatable and streamlined design workflow; rapidly design and prototype products before writing code, and collaborate across their entire organization. That includes more than 80 percent of the Fortune 100, and organizations like Airbnb, Amazon, HBO, Netflix, Slack, Starbucks and Uber, who are now able to design better products, faster.

InVision is a fully distributed company with employees in 25 countries around the world. The company has raised more than $235 million in funding from leading investors including Accel, ICONIQ, FirstMark, Tiger Global, Battery Ventures, and Spark Capital. Visit us at InVisionApp.com and InVisionApp.com/blog.

InVision is looking for a Senior Social Media Manager who can build upon our existing social media strategy and identify ways to take the program to the next level. InVision’s marketing team is extremely fast-paced and juggles multiple priorities at once, so the ideal candidate will have experience working in-house with a start-up or other fast-paced organization and will thrive in an environment where no two days are the same. We’re looking for someone who has experience not only supporting product launches and marketing campaigns, but who can also conceptualize and implement creative social-first campaigns as well. Social media is a highly visible and valued field at InVision, and we are looking for someone who can help grow the role and the team over time. This role will report to the Director of Communications and will have one direct report.

:

Responsibilities
  • Create, implement and optimize the organic social strategy across all social platforms
  • Collaborate with our online marketing team on paid social campaigns
  • Oversee the creation, testing and optimization of content across channels
  • Collaborate with content team to ensure ideal distribution for our blog and other content marketing campaigns
  • Collaborate with events team to find new and innovative ways of promoting a heavy first-party events calendar
  • Work cross-functionally with other members of the marketing team to identify ways to make our existing content and marketing campaigns more social friendly
  • Work with partners and customers to cross-promote InVision content
  • Monitor key metrics and iterate based on insights
  • Conceptualize and launch innovative social-first campaigns that help us reach designers and other target audiences
  • Identify ways to use social media to attract job candidates and advance InVision’s employer brand
  • Create and implement a strategy to encourage employee advocacy on social media
  • Maintain a high-volume social media program that stays consistent to the InVision brand and style

    • :

    Requirements
    • 5-8 years experience working in social media either in-house or a combination of agency and in-house (should primarily be in social media though experience in adjacent areas of marketing such as content and PR will be considered as well)
    • Ideal candidate has worked at a SaaS or fast-paced technology company in the past
    • Demonstrated ability to build, execute and scale social media campaigns across all mainstream social media platforms
    • Superior copywriting abilities
    • Experience conceptualizing and implementing social-first campaigns
    • Experience managing junior team members and building a team
    • Experience interfacing with C-level executives
    • Strong analytic skills – ability to use data to develop, optimize and measure social programs
    • Self-motivated, highly self-sufficient and able to work in an fast-paced environment

      • BENEFITS & PERKS

      InVision offers an incredibly unique work environment. The company employs a diverse team all over the world. In the United States we have team members throughout 40+ states including New York, San Francisco, Austin, Portland, and Boston. Each InVision team member is given the freedom and tools to do their best work from wherever they choose. The benefits we offer in the United States include bold health plans and a 401k plan.

      Some InVision-wide benefits offered to all employees across the globe include a flexible vacation policy, monthly coffee shop stipends, annual allowances for books related to your profession, and home office setup & wellness reimbursements. InVision is an international employer so some benefit offerings will vary from country to country. Please ask our recruiting team about the benefits and perks package available in your country.

      InVision is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know.

      To apply for this job please visit the following URL: https://boards.greenhouse.io/invision/jobs/1301138 →

items.content:
Events Campaign Manager

Marketing
Anywhere
Company: InVision
Contract

Overview

InVision is the Digital Product Design platform used to make the world’s best customer experiences. We provide design tools and educational resources for teams to navigate every stage of the product design process, from ideation to development.

Today, more than 4 million people use InVision to create a repeatable and streamlined design workflow; rapidly design and prototype products before writing code, and collaborate across their entire organization. That includes more than 80 percent of the Fortune 100, and organizations like Airbnb, Amazon, HBO, Netflix, Slack, Starbucks and Uber, who are now able to design better products, faster.

InVision is a fully distributed company with employees in 25 countries around the world. The company has raised more than $235 million in funding from leading investors including Accel, ICONIQ, FirstMark, Tiger Global, Battery Ventures, and Spark Capital. Visit us at InVisionApp.com and InVisionApp.com/blog.

We are hiring an Event Campaign Manager to assist our marketing events team by managing our email campaigns, driving audience acquisition, and working cross functionally throughout InVision to ensure the profitability of our events. This role will be responsible for all integrated campaign efforts and for hitting event attendee registration goals while streamlining communication and promotions.

This is the perfect opportunity for someone who is driven, eager to get elbow-deep in all aspects of marketing, ready to roll-up their sleeves, and be a key player in the success of a fast-growing company.

Requirements:
  • Bachelor’s Degree in marketing or related work experience
  • 3-5 years of Campaign Marketing experience is a must
  • Experience working on or closely with a field marketing team and/or marketing events team
  • Lead Generation
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills
  • Strong collaboration, communication, and organizational skills required
  • Ability to self direct and self motivate (remote office)
  • Adaptable and comfortable with change and ambiguity
  • Experience with international markets preferred
  • Salesforce Experience preferred; specifically with creating Salesforce campaigns
  • Marketing automation experience with Hubspot or similar product
  • Project management experience preferred; Detail oriented and accurate; enjoys identifying and solving problems; works well under deadlines and can communicate changes across the organization
  • Remote work experience a plus
  • Able to travel if needed, less than 10% of time time
  • A team player with a level head and a sense of humor

    • Qualities:

    You are a marketer by trade with a passion for events and a drive to succeed. You thrive in fast-paced environments and are comfortable with ambiguity and change. You have a can-do attitude and a strong desire to contribute to the team and work together to find solutions to issues.  You frequently ask yourself “Where is the data to support that claim?” and dig deep to find answers.

    Responsibilities:
    • Coordinate all deliverables between campaign stakeholders for the events team, including email, website, discount code creation, content and social.
    • Develop and manage marketing plan (including channel strategies) to achieve revenue and registration goals for relevant events
    • Structure registration incentives (discount codes) to support attendance and financial goals
    • Manage creative, content, and technical requests for all event marketing campaigns and ensure all deadlines are met.
    • Develop and communicate an integrated campaign calendar for events. Partnering with Content, Product Marketing, Design Education, Design Transformation, Design and Field Marketing.
    • Align with Sales and Marketing Operations to ensure success with lead follow-up and campaign goals. Monitor reports for lead quality and follow-up within SLA.
    • Create all documentation for Sales (FAQ cards, call/email scripts, campaign notes) for all  event campaigns.
    • Collaborating with Field Marketing, define the target account list for event campaigns we do, so that marketing efforts are focused on the accounts that the sales teams want to engage with most.
    • Work with the event technology team to create and maintain event websites on reg platforms
    • Collaborate with social media team on social promotions and digital marketing team when paid ads are needed.
    • Work with Marketing Automation on email creation, testing, and sends
      • Work with internal cross functional teams to leverage customer insights to develop the best possible value proposition, messaging/positioning and content to drive campaigns
      • Align content to the different stages of the customer journey – tailoring content to right persona
      • Lead on-going analysis to optimize campaigns and identify trends
      • Provide reports on CPA for marketing tactics

        • BENEFITS & PERKS

        InVision offers an incredibly unique work environment. The company employs a diverse team all over the world. In the United States we have team members throughout 40+ states including New York, San Francisco, Austin, Portland, and Boston. Each InVision team member is given the freedom and tools to do their best work from wherever they choose.

        InVision is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know.

        To apply for this job please visit the following URL: https://boards.greenhouse.io/invision/jobs/1301214 →

items.title: Sales Development Representative (Chicago)
tags: DBG:surround``OR(locat, base, resid) 3W OR(berlin, london, pari)
items.content:
Sales Development Representative (Chicago)

Sales
Anywhere in US
Company: Akkroo
ContractPart Time

Overview

Note: This is a contract, part-time role that requires regular travel to Chicago, IL.

ABOUT AKKROO

Here at Akkroo, we’re on a mission to help businesses think differently about exhibiting and the way they capture and process leads at B2B trade shows and events.

We’re at the forefront of a new, emerging category that bridges the big gap between exhibiting at events and the organisation’s existing Sales and Marketing processes.

We’re based in London, UK, however have a large and growing customer base in the US and in line with our recent Series A funding are now hiring for Sales Development Representatives in key US locations, including Chicago.

Sales Development Representatives play an incredibly important role in Akkroo, helping us to proactively qualify buying interest, understand size and shape of potential accounts and line them up for further conversations and demos with the Account Executive team.

ABOUT THE ROLE 

This role is all about helping us to generate well qualified sales leads in the US.

The role will involve a mixture of:

  • visiting local B2B trade shows, exhibitions and events, mostly at McCormick Place Exhibition Centre, to open conversations with great-fit customers
  • prospecting into target accounts, utilizing a modern suite of outbound sales tools, campaigns and social outreach
  • handling inbound enquiries received via the Akkroo.com website outside of UK working hours to qualify those leads and transition into the sales pipeline

    • You’ll be part of our larger, UK-based Sales team with a focus on identifying and qualifying great-fit customers which are then passed over to our Account Executive team for demo and closing

    You’ll also work alongside our Marketing team to identify sectors, organizations and events to target

    This is a part time, remote and flexible contract position – the exact number of hours each week may vary, but we’re anticipating around 30 hours.

    ABOUT YOU
    • You have previous B2B sales experience, either as an Account Executive or SDR role, ideally within a Software-as-a-Service (SaaS) organization
    • You love speaking to new people and are just as comfortable face-to-face as you are on the phone, via email or live chat through our website
    • You’re willing and able to travel to events (occasionally at weekends) to meet new prospects
    • As this is a remote role, you’re able to do great work independently and love the challenge of solving problems, proactively tackling challenges and when you don’t know something, you embrace the chance to grow and get better
    • You’re setup to work remotely, with a suitable working environment and able to invoice us on a bi-weekly basis for your hours worked as a contractor

      • WHAT WE’RE OFFERING

      This is a fantastic opportunity to join a successful European scale-up as one of our early teammates on the ground in the US

      We’re paying competitive salary, based on an hourly rate for a fixed number of hours. On top of this, you’ll receive a commission scheme based on generating Sales Qualified Leads

      You’ll be provided with all the tools you need to successfully do the job, including a MacBook and access to a suite of software that we use, including Slack, LinkedIn Sales Navigator, SalesLoft and Hubspot CRM

      To apply for this job please visit the following URL: http://akkroo.recruiterbox.com/jobs/fk01l8a?apply=true →

items.content:
Account Executive - North America

Company: Qwilr
Headquarters: Sydney, Australia
http://jobs.qwilr.com/o/account-executive-north-america
We're looking for an experienced Account Executive based out of the North America to join our growing global sales team. 

At Qwilr, our sales team serves as a trusted advisor for prospects and customers - listening to their needs, clearly explaining what Qwilr is (and isn't), and leading our initial training and onboarding efforts to make sure everyone is successful for the long term. 

Note: While you can be located anywhere in North America, you will need to be comfortable working Pacific coast hours so that you can overlap with the team in Sydney. 

To see this page as a beautiful Qwilr, and get more details, here.

Requirements

You have 2+ years of successful selling to SMBs, and have experience working on deals similar in size (1k to 10k ACV) and volume to the ones you’d be working on at Qwilr. 

You have worked for an excellent SaaS Sales company. This could be a startup or a big player like Salesforce or HubSpot, but we're looking for someone who has experienced an excellent sales culture. 

You are excellent at inbound - but you're not afraid of occasional outbound. We get thousands of inbound leads per month - but there are times that outbound makes sense. 

You know your way around a modern CRM. You will need this for your day-to-day, as well as for helping our clients as we embed deeply into CRMs like Salesforce & HubSpot. 

You are in sales because you love helping people win. It energises you to work alongside people to improve their business. 

You are naturally curious and have a history of learning new things quickly. At Qwilr, our product is always evolving, as is our market. Things will change - you need to be comfortable adapting to that change. 

You excel at managing yourself like a successful business. You are highly organised, you set and achieve goals with regularity, you create a great customer experience, and you make your teammates better. 

Above all, you’re an entrepreneur and are excited by the prospect of building your business and hitting your quarterly and annual goals. 

The Simple Benefits 

Competitive Salary & Comp - with uncapped commissions. 
Equity - Everyone at Qwilr owns a meaningful stake in our success. 
Paid parental leave - 12 weeks for primary caretaker and 4 weeks for secondary caretaker. 
Company Retreats - Every year we get together to meet and work in person in an amazing location somewhere in the Pacific (typically near a beach). 
Complete transparency - Everyone has access to business metrics and financial information about the company. 
Further Education support - We'll cover all courses below $1000 and split the ones above with you 50/50. We'll happily buy you any business books you'd like to read - even if they're outside of your role. 

The Real Benefits

Impact

Every member of Qwilr is actively encouraged to input and contribute to the direction of the product and the company. We actually have a formal process around The Big Questions at Qwilr called “Group Think”. Ideas can come from any quarter and shape our whole trajectory. 

Work with smart people who care about what they do

We’ve got that list of impressive backgrounds we can reel off (Google, Microsoft, Campaign Monitor, McKinsey, Harvard etc) - but what you really need to know is this: Qwilr is fierce about finding the best people and providing them an environment to flourish. That means we’ve got a team of really smart people, who really care about, and take pride, in what they do. 

We have a high bar of excellence 

Our first principle as a company is “Undeniable Bestness”. We believe in winning our race by being the best, not throughs hacks, bandaids and shortcuts. This means we have a high bar of excellence at the company. We go back to the drawing board when things aren't right, because we care deeply about the quality of what we produce.



Our Process - What To Expect.


  • Tell Us Something About Yourself: Together with your CV, send in a Qwilr Page telling us who you are, why you think you would be great for the role, and what your favourite sale was. 
  • Chat with our Talent & Culture Lead: If your Qwilr Page resonates with us, we'll set up a get-to-know-you chat with Elisa. 
  • Chat with a Founder: If you look like a good fit you'll chat with Mark, the Founder who leads our Sales team. 
  • Pitch us Qwilr:  We find that there is no better way to find out if someone will be good for the job than to have them do the job in a simulated environment. We do this in some capacity for all hires across Qwilr. This task will mirror what it’s like working with our prospects in a sales call. 
  • Chat with the sales team: As things progress you’ll chat with two or three of our Sales & Success team. This will be an opportunity for you to get to know us at a human level, and for us to get to know you. 


Why Qwilr?


Qwilr makes it easy for people to express themselves using the web. 

We have thousands of customers from over 50 countries, we have an excellent product, our team is doubling in size every year (and our revenue is growing even faster), we are backed by some of the best SaaS investors on the planet, and we are growing like crazy. 

Now is the time to join.

Apply for this position

To Apply head to: http://jobs.qwilr.com/o/account-executive-north-america And submit a CV as well as a Qwilr Page telling us A) Who you are and why you think you would be great for this role, and B) What your favourite / best sale was. We want to know the details, why it mattered to you, how you did a great job and anything else that you think is relevant / impressive.

items.title: Social Media Manager
items.content:
Social Media Manager at PayBear

Remote | Freelance | International

Remote

Contract

Skills
Social Media, Social Media Marketing
Compensation
$58K – $90K
No Equity
Visa Sponsorship
Not available

We’re a small, distributed startup in a competitive space trying to do the impossible. We’re creating a payment platform for ecommerce & SaaS merchants to easily accept cryptocurrencies. We’ve already built a product that’s way ahead of the competition, but now we need key talent to scale.

Job Description

Paybear is a cutting-edge cryptocurrency platform working towards the creation of a global toolkit for crypto-based financial products. With the initial version of our payment gateway already up and running, we’re currently focused on incorporating new products into our growing ecosystem.

Now, we’re on the hunt for a Social Media Manager to take control of our voice and build a community that’s as excited about the future of crypto as we are. You’ll be leading our social media strategy, curating our brand presence and driving engagement with passionate crypto fans across the globe.

Responsibilities

  • Research and analyze leading trends, communication methods and audience preferences.
  • Design and implement an effective social media strategy to enhance business objectives.
  • Set specific, measurable objectives and report on ROI.
  • Create, edit, publish and share engaging content on a daily basis (e.g. original text, photos, videos and news).
  • Monitor SEO and web traffic metrics.
  • Collaborate with other teams, including marketing, sales and customer service, to ensure brand consistency and create engaging, shareable stories.
  • Engage regularly with the community and monitor customer reviews.
  • Supervise the creation of design assets, including Facebook cover images, profile pictures, banners and so on.
  • Create and implement new features and campaigns to cultivate brand awareness, such as promotions, competitions and other engagement initiatives.
  • Passionately follow current tech and trends in social media, design tools and applications.

Requirements

  • Fluent English, both spoken and written.
  • 3+ years’ proven experience in social media management.
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
  • Hands-on experience in content management.
  • Ability to conceptualize and deliver creative content (text, image and video).
  • Knack for distilling complex social media data into easily-digestible takeaways.
  • A natural multi-tasker able to handle a variety of ongoing projects.
  • Deep knowledge of Facebook’s advertising platform is a must.
  • Knowledge of various online marketing channels.
  • Willingness to learn new channels and platforms relevant to crypto and ICO communities.

Terms of employment

  • Full-time: 40 hours/week.
  • From $30 USD/hr.

Our advantages

  • No corporate drudgery: Work when you want, how you want, and where you want. Our international team is fully remote.
  • Absolute freedom: Our lean approach will give you the independence needed to solve challenges your way. We’re dedicated to the startup spirit.
  • Cutting-edge tech: Gain priceless, hands-on experience with crypto currencies and other leading technologies.
  • Friendly English-speaking team: Forge meaningful relationships with colleagues around the world.
Apply for job

Associate, Partner Management at FITPASS

Delhi, Noida, Remote · Full Time
Skills
Business Development, Sales Strategy and Management, MS Office, Sales and Marketing, Communication Skills
Compensation
₹240K–₹360K
No Equity

Job Description

Job Responsibilities:

-Identifying key players in the industry through extensive market research and converting them into fitpass partners

-Imparting necessary training to partnered fitness studios to help them use the CRM system to their maximum advantage

items.content:
Director of Business Management

Company: Aha Media Group
Headquarters: Silver Spring, MD
https://ahamediagroup.com/
Directorof Business Management will lead operations, finance and technology for afast-growing company. This person will report to the President, be a part ofthe Executive leadership team, and manage the Bookkeeper and Systems Manager.

Whilethis is a primarily remote position, you must live within the Washington D.C. metropolitanarea to travel to company headquarters in Silver Spring, MD up to 2 times perweek. Commuting expenses will not be reimbursed.

Theideal candidate willdemonstrate the ability to:
· Forecast business needs and adjust businessoperations to respond to needs
· Take an “outside-the-box” approach toproblem-solving
· Communicate business performance, stats andpriorities to the President and provide 
  analysis and plausible solutions

You willhave a bachelor’s degree in accounting, finance or related field and alsobe expected to travel to in-person team meetings approximately 2-4 times peryear.

Responsibilities
  • Financial operations, including accounts receivables, accounts payable, budget, financial reporting and analysis, and payroll processing in multiple states
  • Business operations, including contracts and vendor paperwork, project compliance, insurances, SIMPLE IRA and business registrations
  • Information technology and business systems, including Salesforce, email client management, web-hosting and domain registrations, project management software, and other office systems
  • Pricing analysis and financial forecasting, including implementing processes and systems to achieve profit targets as well as support sales strategies

You Have
  • 7-10 years of accounting or finance experience ideally in a small business environment
  • Bachelor’s degree in accounting, finance or related field
  • Proven experience managing junior team members
  • Expertise in QuickBooks and Excel
  • Proficiency in Salesforce and ability to quickly learn other business software as needed
  • Excellent organizational skills; this role involves a lot of moving pieces
  • Knowledge that the devil is in the details—no i goes undotted, no t goes uncrossed
  • Excellent communication skills, this role involves communication with clients and internal team members
  • A scrappy, can-do attitude with a willingness to try new ways of thinking and working
  • Proven ability to manage confidential information
  • Ability to work from 9-5, Monday through Friday
  • Ability to travel to onsite meetings at least twice a week in Silver Spring, MD
  • Proven ability to successfully work from home

Aha Media is a fast-pacedatmosphere. If these align with your values, you should apply:
·  Above and beyond, no matter what,every single time: We hire exceptional people 
   and expect them todeliver their very best—every time.

·  Meaningful work, meaningful life: We put inthe time we need to get the job done 
   in the best way possible, and then we go home to the people and hobbies we love.

·  Be impeccable with your words andyour intentions: We are respectful and direct 
   communicators whosay the things we mean and mean the things we say.

·  Stay curious longer: Weapproach every challenge with a fresh perspective and 
   explore new approachesand solutions.

·  Always be learning: We focuson continuous learning and self-improvement.

Apply for this position

If you are interested, please submit:• Resume• Cover letter (include where you found the job posting, the city & state you live in, your educational background and # of years accounting, finance or related experience)• Please include a P.S. with the number 6 in your cover letter and send your application to careers@ahamediagroup.com

items.content:
Backend Developer (for our ROIBACK business)

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Mid-Level
Role: Backend Developer
Industry: B2B, Information Technology, Travel & Tourism
Company size: 5k-10k people
Company type: Private
Company: The Hotelbeds Group | Palma, Spain

Remote details

Office Location: Palma, Spain. Employees can also work full time from this office.
Relocation Assistance: Yes

Technologies

javascript
python
sql
html5
linux

Job description

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES.


How can you help us?

We are seeking for top programmers and software architects to be part of our technology team.

As a software developer:


• As part of our booking engine team, implementing user stories with high business value using good techniques and practices.
• Helping the Product Ower in clarifying, prioritizing and estimating the user stories.
• Designing technical solutions and developing clear, testesable and efficient code, performing peer reviews with your collegueas.
• Ensuring continuous integration and build is in place.
• Collaborating with architects and other developers to produce just enough design and just enough technical documentation.
• Writing technical user stories for refactoring the existing code or implementing new technical features.

As a software architect:


• Doing some up front architecture envisioning to get started the developments in the right direction, collaboratively working with the team.
• Facilitating the architectural modeling and evolution efforts of our technological platform.
• Understanding of the business domain and communicating the architecture to developers and to other project stakeholders.
• Practising code review, pair programming and other agile techniques to improve the development team programming skills.
• Transitioning architectural skills to other team members

What can we offer you?


• To participate in very challenging projects with the top hotel chains from Europe, Asia and America, from the idea to the delivery.
• To work in a Company that invests (really invests) in technology.
• To be part of an Agile culture to obtain the best results in software development and to become a high-performance team, in a really happy environment.
• Work together with extremely passionate programmers, and being part of a top programmer community.
• To be part of a team-making decisions, to determine the technical roadmap of our platforms.
• To lead both business and technical projects from end-to-end.
• To live in the best city of the World

(http://www.thesundaytimes.co.uk/sto/style/homes_and_gardens/best_places/article1533629.ece)

CANDIDATE PROFILE.

• It is a must to hold a University degree in Engineering or Computing Sciences, or having completed at least 80%.
•  If you know Python or Go ... excellent! But what we are really looking for is a top programmer who loves technology and software development, and ready to learn any programming language that could be required.
• You have to feel comfortable working with databases (SQL and NoSQL), web programming (HTML5, CSS3, Javascript) and Linux environments.
• Good programming best-practices, such continuous integration, unit testing generation, code repositories, log management, code comments and documentation ...
• You will need to meet with the business to understand the needs and to translate them into code.
• You will be part of an agile team, so, what is really important in Roiback is the team success, not the individual success.
• It is not a must to have a lot of experience. For us, what is really important is the potential and attitude you have to become a great programmer

Apply now

About The Hotelbeds Group

Roiback.com

About us

We specialise in the development and management of online projects for hotel chains and independent hotels. We not only have a knack for all things digital, but we also have a knack for people. We know that the closer we are to you, the better and more adapted solutions we'll provide to your business. We have over 15 years experience in the industry, which has allowed us to develop a team of professionals who exceed in their fields. WHAT WE DO: We work with our partners to get to the nitty gritty of their business. This allows us to design custom-made solutions that deliver tangible results and provide a real answer to market demand. Our passion allows us to never stop improving our service and product offering, day in, day out. • Integrated Marketing Online Management. We help you build your brand differentiation in today’s crowded digital space. We have a flair for everything online and a real passion for the hospitality industry. Our method is quite simple: we first analyse your needs and then define action plans that make sense for you. We bring you a fresh approach to help you get the most out of your marketing spend, finding cost-effective ways to drive more traffic, and more bookings, to your website. • Web Design & Development. Our websites are specifically created for with the hotelier in mind. Designed to work on any device, strikingly beautiful and with a slick user experience. We are passionate about building websites that will engage visitors and drive conversions, taking direct channel sales to a new level. • Booking Engine for Hotels // BACKHOTEL 4.5 We specialise in creating technology that works for hoteliers. Our booking engine brings together beautiful design and seamless user experience to capture and convert your web traffic into bookings for your direct channel. • Technology We have direct integrations with the industry’s main Channel Managers and Property Management Systems to simplify the way you manage your direct channel.

items.title: Sales Development Representative
tags: DBG:surround``OR(locat, base, resid) 3W OR(berlin, london, pari)
items.content:
ABOUT US

Here at Akkroo, we’re on a mission to help businesses think differently about exhibiting and the way they capture and process leads at B2B trade shows and events.

We’re at the forefront of a new, emerging category that bridges the big gap between exhibiting at events and the organisation’s existing Sales and Marketing processes.

We’re based in London, UK, however have a large and growing customer base in the US and in line with our recent Series A funding are now hiring for Sales Development Representatives in key US locations, including Chicago.

Sales Development Representatives play an incredibly important role in Akkroo, helping us to proactively qualify buying interest, understand size and shape of potential accounts and line them up for further conversations and demos with the Account Executive team.

ABOUT THE ROLE 

  • This role is all about helping us to generate well qualified sales leads in the US
  • The role will involve a mixture of:
    • visiting local B2B trade shows, exhibitions and events, mostly at McCormick Place Exhibition Centre, to open conversations with great-fit customers
    • prospecting into target accounts, utilizing a modern suite of outbound sales tools, campaigns and social outreach
    • handling inbound enquiries received via the Akkroo.com website outside of UK working hours to qualify those leads and transition into the sales pipeline
  • You’ll be part of our larger, UK-based Sales team with a focus on identifying and qualifying great-fit customers which are then passed over to our Account Executive team for demo and closing
  • You’ll also work alongside our Marketing team to identify sectors, organizations and events to target
  • This is a part time, remote and flexible contract position - the exact number of hours each week may vary, but we’re anticipating around 30 hours. 

ABOUT YOU

  • You have previous B2B sales experience, either as an Account Executive or SDR role, ideally within a Software-as-a-Service (SaaS) organization
  • You love speaking to new people and are just as comfortable face-to-face as you are on the phone, via email or live chat through our website
  • You’re willing and able to travel to events (occasionally at weekends) to meet new prospects
  • As this is a remote role, you’re able to do great work independently and love the challenge of solving problems, proactively tackling challenges and when you don’t know something, you embrace the chance to grow and get better
  • You’re setup to work remotely, with a suitable working environment and able to invoice us on a bi-weekly basis for your hours worked as a contractor

WHAT WE’RE OFFERING

  • This is a fantastic opportunity to join a successful European scale-up as one of our early teammates on the ground in the US
  • We’re paying competitive salary, based on an hourly rate for a fixed number of hours. On top of this, you’ll receive a commission scheme based on generating Sales Qualified Leads
  • You’ll be provided with all the tools you need to successfully do the job, including a MacBook and access to a suite of software that we use, including Slack, LinkedIn Sales Navigator, SalesLoft and Hubspot CRM

items.title: Emily Hirsh, Inc. : Facebook Ads Manager
items.content:
Facebook Ads Manager

Company: Emily Hirsh, Inc.
Headquarters: Remote
https://emilyhirsh.com
Department: Advertising Team
Reports to: Senior Digital Strategist

Role
  • Creating and managing client campaigns on a daily basis through a strategic lens, communicating with the client, sending weekly reports and supporting the client with strategic consultations as needed.


Responsibilities
  • Understanding the strategy of a specific campaign and client funnel

  • Tasking out different components of a campaign such as images and copy to the correct contractors

  • Loading or tasking the loading of campaigns/ads to the ads specialists

  • Reviewing, editing & loading of ad assets as needed

  • Placing and verifying pixel to ensure proper campaign tracking

  • Daily optimization of campaigns to ensure the lowest possible cost per result and an overall positive ROI

  • Proactively create, execute, and optimize creative strategies to consistently drive high-quality leads, traffic & visibility

  • Produce weekly reports for client account updates, recommendations and results

  • Follow-up with client communications, questions and concerns in a timely manner

  • Stay on top of new techniques, strategies and changes to test for better client results & campaign successes

  • Communicating with clients about the success of the campaign, and offering suggestions for ways to improve

  • Schedule & perform monthly client meetings & consultations for account goals and strategic success of each client account

  • Participate in daily, monthly and quarterly team huddles to ensure agency team members are all meeting company goals & responsibilities

Results:
First 90 days: Learn each assigned clients account and launch strategies with direction from the Director of Advertising to ensure proper execution of client goals and success. Master the “Hirsh Process” for proper client account management and ongoing optimization. Feel 100% confident by the end of the 90-day period that you can manage your accounts with minimal support and oversight needed from the Director of Advertising or the CEO.

After initial 90 days: Ads Manager should be able to perform all client tasks, communications and strategy consulting with minimal direction from the Director of Advertising and moving to be a trusted main source of contact for strategy consultation for the client while reporting to the Director of Advertising for strategy updates, guidance & insight. The ads manager will continue to learn and grow and bring innovative strategies to the Hirsh Agency and our clients.

Requirements
  • 2+ years of online marketing experience
  • Dedication to problem-solving and the ability to analyze results and make suggestions to the client based on their individual results
  • High attention to detail, proofreading, writing and editing skills for accuracy
  • Mid - Expert level knowledge of Facebook advertising (minimum 1-2 years experience)
  • Quick learner who retains information easily
  • Knowledge of various 3rd party platforms such as ClickFunnels, MailChimp, etc
  • Ability to communicate effectively
  • Access to a high-speed internet connection
  • Good time management and organization skills as a remote worker
  • Ability to communicate with clients via email & video meetings.
  • Understanding of Funnel Marketing strategies & the psychology of advertising to the customer journey
  • Excellent verbal communication skills
  • Committed to ongoing education and training to stay on top of the Facebook platform, rules, regulations, strategies and updates for proper ad execution, implementation & client success


Details: 
  • Paid training that leads to base and incentive compensation based on performance

Apply for this position

Send your resume and cover letter to jobs@emilyhirsh.com

Job Description

We are looking for a communicative rock star with a passion and willingness to make things happen. If you can't wait to write captivating copy, we can't wait to hear from you.

YOU:
We are looking for an intelligent creative person with excellent verbal and written communication skills to join our Marketing and Communications team.
An interest in organic, vegan and fair-trade products is definitely a plus, but don’t lie about it, it’s not more important than being real.

THE JOB:
You will have the opportunity to work on a variety of digital media and communications tasks including, but not limited to:

- Designing and implementing social media and email strategy to align with TrySome’s business goals
- Generate, edit and publish engaging social media content daily (e.g. original text, photos, videos and news)
- Conduct market research
- Send out email campaigns to our subscribers
- Monitor Google Analytics and web traffic metrics, adjusting social media and email campaigns accordingly to increase web traffic
- Communicate with TrySome subscribers and social media followers. Respond to customer service inquiries in a timely manner and monitor comments and reviews
- Initiate and implement new features to develop brand awareness, like promotions, Instagram challenge or competitions
- Initiate creative growth efforts to increase number of users and manufacturers on the platform

You should have basic understanding of SEO and set up KPIs to monitor progress. You will work directly with the Chief Marketing Officer for guidance.
This position is unpaid and requires a commitment of at least 3 full days per week, preferably full time. If you prove invaluable a full time position is a possibility. We prefer if you are in NYC and can come to the office, but working remotely is an option.

We are looking forward to hearing from you.

Application deadline & start date: Next internship starting in March. Apply asap. We will on-board the first right person.

TO APPLY:

Send us an email with:
- Your resume
- A writing sample (write a draft post for 2 of our 4 different social media platforms). For each post please explain why you think the particular post is good for that particular platform.

tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=3, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=8, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Are you a curious innovator? A passionate problem solver? Born digital? And maybe a little wild at heart? If so, read on.

We’re DCMN – the growth marketing partner for digital businesses and startups. Our holistic, data-driven approach combines technology with expert knowledge to grow the market leaders of tomorrow. Our vision is bold: we want everyone in the world to use one of our client’s services. If you have the drive to get us there, let’s talk.


Join our ambitious, supportive and international team, and you’ll work on the following:
- Develop growth solutions for digital brands together with your client team, always with our mission in mind: to grow the market leaders of tomorrow
- Take full responsibility for assigned clients and their marketing campaigns (focus on performance-driven TV campaigns)
- Challenge client briefs and internal teams to ensure we deliver stuff that sets us apart
- Interpretation of campaign results and ability to explain them to clients and discuss the results with them on an advanced level
- Planning, buying, controlling and on-going optimisation of international marketing campaigns (with a strong focus on TV campaigns)
- Prepare comprehensible campaign reports, based on our own TV attribution tool and third-party tools
- Build good, yield-rich and long-term relationships with our (international) customers
- Advise digital commerce companies about opportunities to scale their business with data-driven and intelligent marketing campaigns
- Effectively communicate and promote our vision and philosophy to potential new clients and stakeholders
- Live the startup vibe, act as an entrepreneur, have a hands-on approach and proactively identify opportunities that go beyond your daily account managing tasks to help grow our business in the UK market


Of course we’ll need you to bring along a few things, including:
- At least 4 years working experience in digital marketing and/or DRTV
- 3-5 years of experience in planning, buying, controlling and on-going optimisation of TV campaigns in the UK (preferably also internationally)
- Good network of contacts in the UK offline/TV landscape
- First experience with Sky Advanced products, OTT campaigns and video advertising are beneficial
- Proficiency with tools such as Techedge/IMD - CARIA, etc.
- Knowledge of other offline channels (radio, OOH, etc.)
- Not afraid of working with numbers and Excel, plus strong analytical skills
- Previous experience within a startup and/or in the field of marketing for digital brands is a big plus
- Efficient and result-oriented working style
- Fluent in English (written & spoken)


And here’s what you’ll get in return for working with us:
- An awesome WeWork office space in the heart of Shoreditch full of radically supportive colleagues
- Support for your personal and professional growth, whether this means regular massage sessions and pilates classes or an overseas conference trip
- Flexibility to manage your own hours and work from home whenever you need
- A multicultural work environment, plus the chance to visit our international offices and apply for our exchange program. One year placement in New York, anyone?
- No hierarchies, freedom and full responsibility from day one. We believe top-down hierarchies just limit our progress – so we’ve created a whole new way of working

Can’t wait to get started? Then we’d love to hear from you. Please send us your CV along with any relevant documents and your earliest possible starting date. And don’t hesitate to reach out if you have any questions!

Dataiku is looking for an experienced Account Executive whose native language is English to join our EU sales team (based in Paris or remotely) to focus on a large European territory. In addition to strong product-market fit, the territory benefits from extensive marketing and sales exposure over the past 18 months with significant latent demand.

The role consists of engaging prospects and customers on the topic of their Big Data and Advanced Analytics initiatives and to help them develop a more efficient approach, leveraging Dataiku DSS. The Account Executive is responsible for the entire sales cycle, leveraging various company resources, to reach a successful collaboration with the prospect.

Dataiku is a young company with great momentum and at this early stage, the Account Executive is likely to work cross-functionally with Marketing, Product Management and Engineering, and will be a key player in defining Dataiku's European strategy. We’re looking for someone who can express passion about the new technologies and possibilities of Big Data and Advanced Analytics.

items.content:
Account Executive (m/f) // Perdoo

Company: Perdoo

Tags:
  • communication skills
  • customer success
  • account executive
  • management consulting

    • We are looking for a full-time Account Executive who will report directly to one of our founders. As our first Sales hire you’ll be responsible for selling Perdoo to CEOs and senior level execs at companies in the EU and US.

    About us

    We’re an ambitious team of entrepreneurs excited about building the next big thing in B2B. Perdoo helps companies turn ambition into reality with our SaaS tool which is based on OKR – a goal management framework used by top-achieving businesses like Google and LinkedIn. By focusing companies around common objectives, we help them fix the broken link between strategy and execution so that everyone can work together on a clear path towards success. Many well-known companies throughout the world already trust us and our product.

    About the position

    You’ll be the most important source of revenue growth at Perdoo. Your main responsibility is to convert incoming leads to customers. You’ll be selling Perdoo to CEOs and senior level execs at companies in the EU and US. Sales at Perdoo is entirely inbound and done from our headquarters in Berlin. Hence, there’s no need for exhaustive traveling, neither do you have to disturb anyone with cold calls or cold emails. Instead, you’ll talk to prospects who have already shown an interest in our product and services, allowing you to take a consultative approach by showing them how best we can help them realize their ambitions. As we scale, your insights will dictate how our sales team operates at 10x its current size.

    As our Account Executive you will

    • Achieve revenue goals and contribute to Perdoo’s overall sales strategy and growth objectives.
    • Qualify and prioritize incoming leads.
    • Perform sales demos that give prospects a good and thorough understanding of the Perdoo product and services.

    We’d love to hear from you if you

    • Have 1-4 years experience working in sales, customer success or management consulting.
    • Have at least a Bachelor’s degree.
    • Are fluent in English, German would be a plus.
    • Have some flexibility in terms of working hours as a considerable amount of our prospects is located in the US.
    • Have excellent verbal and written communication skills.
    • Are an autonomous worker and self-starter.

    What we offer

    • A fixed salary, benefits and employee stock option plan.
    • Contribute to a real-life product used by thousands of users every day.
    • Work in a dynamic, exciting and fun startup environment where every person has a voice and can have a real impact on company success.
    • Office in Berlin-Mitte, the heart of Europe’s startup scene.
    • Regular team retreats to remote locations. Last time we took the team to a finca in Mallorca.
    • An awesome rooftop overlooking Berlin with regular after-work drinks, BBQs and our annual Rooftop Party.
    • Free food and coffee in our kitchen.
    Apply for this position
